name: woundwort
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a name given to several different plants used in the past to put on wounds (= damaged areas of the body): You may see marsh woundwort (Stachys palustris) still flowering during October. Hedge woundwort, a non-stinging relative of the red deadnettle, has tiny, edible flowers that taste like honey.
More examplesFewer examplesThis woundwort is beloved by gardeners for its silver-green leaves and lavender flowers.Achillea is also known as soldier's woundwort and bloodwort, and it was used as a poultice during the American Civil War.
